de.unisiegen.tpml.core.smallstep
Interface SmallStepProofContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultSmallStepProofContext
public interface SmallStepProofContext

Base interface to context related information and methods when determining the next small steps in the implementation of the AbstractSmallStepProofRuleSet.

Version:
$Rev: 277 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
AbstractSmallStepProofRuleSet

Method Summary
 void addProofStep(ProofRule rule, Expression expression)
          Adds a new proof step with the specified rule for the given expression.
 Expression getExpression()
          Returns the resulting expression.
 ProofStep[] getSteps()
          Returns the ProofSteps that were performed during the evaluation.
 Store getStore()
          Returns the resulting store.
 

Method Detail

getExpression

Expression getExpression()
Returns the resulting expression. The resulting expression may be the same as the initial expression if the evaluation got stuck at some point or the proof is complete. During the evaluation in the AbstractSmallStepProofRuleSet implementation this method will always return the initial expression, and will return the resulting expression only after the evaluation completed.

Returns:
the resulting Expression.
See Also:
Expression

getSteps

ProofStep[] getSteps()
Returns the ProofSteps that were performed during the evaluation.

Returns:
the evaluation steps.
See Also:
ProofStep

getStore

Store getStore()
Returns the resulting store. The evaluation methods in the proof rule set should modify the returned Store direly, i.e. to implement the ref operator.

Returns:
the resulting Store.
See Also:
Store

addProofStep

void addProofStep(ProofRule rule,
                  Expression expression)
Adds a new proof step with the specified rule for the given expression.

Parameters:
rule - the small step proof rule to add as proof step.
expression - the Expression for the proof step.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if rule or expression is null.
See Also:
getSteps()
